events.message: The insured reported a car accident involving a collision with a tree on a local road.
The claim was categorized as an auto accident based on the description of the vehicle collision.
An agent was assigned to handle the vehicle accident claim and started initial communications.
The insured was notified that their claim for the auto accident had been officially acknowledged.
The agent requested photos of the vehicle damage and a police report to proceed with investigation.
The insured submitted photos of the damaged car along with the police accident report as requested.
Investigation began to verify the cause of the vehicle collision and assess the extent of damages.
The investigation confirmed that the insured was not at fault for the auto accident collision.
A settlement offer was made to cover the repair costs and vehicle replacement as per the policy.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and quick claim handling process.
The claim was officially approved after the customer accepted the settlement terms offered.
The payment for the approved auto accident claim was successfully issued to the insured's bank account.
The auto accident claim was closed after payment was made and all policy conditions were met.
